p: One of the most important aspects of multiplex PCR detection methods is primer interaction-primer dimers. We used standard plasmids to simulate duplex and triplex co-infection at low concentrations using standard plasmids of 10 3 and 10 2 copies/Î¼L ( Fig. 4 ). We found that the fluorescence channels corresponding to the targeted virus could be accurately detected, even regardless of the pairing combination.
